conclusion: To find the work done by the frictional force of the conveyor belt on the object as it is transported from point M to point N, we need to calculate the distance the object travels along the conveyor belt and the frictional force acting on the object.
The frictional force F_f can be calculated using the formula F_f = μ ⋅ N, where μ is the coefficient of kinetic friction and N is the normal force.
Since the object is on a horizontal surface, the normal force N is equal to the gravitational force mg, where m is the mass of the object and g is the acceleration due to gravity.
The distance traveled by the object along the conveyor belt is equal to the distance between the two drive wheels M and N, which is L_1 = 10 m.
The work done W by the frictional force can be calculated using the formula W = F ⋅ d, where F is the force and d is the distance over which the force is applied.
The work done by the frictional force of the conveyor belt on the object as it is transported from point M to point N is 90 J.
